titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Garrit S.K. Remsen accounts and collection records for Flatlands School District No.2 1977.493
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:11:11 +0000.

did.unittitle: Garrit S.K. Remsen accounts and collection records for Flatlands School District No.2
did.abstract: Handwritten financial accounts and collection records for School District No. 2 in the town of Flatlands in Brooklyn, recorded by Collector Garrit (also spelled Garret) S.K. Remsen. The accounts date from 1894 and 1895.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Miss Augusta G. Smith, 1957.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Garrit S.K. Remsen accounts and collection records for Flatlands School District No.2, 1977.493, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
